@Cosmicthepirate

Make sure you downloaded the minecraft client specific to your os off of the official site. Go to your user systems for the application support, not from disk. Delete the current minecraft folder and leave the finder open open. Copy the minecraft folder from the torrent and paste it in the past minecraft's place. Then try running minecraft.
By users system i mean yourusername/library/application support.

Now then, put the official app on your desktop, open it, and type random stuff for the user and pass. Then play offline! Worked perfect for me :D

i almost pissed my pants when i realized that you have to HOLD down your mouse button. LOL

guys to run the minecraft, y download the latest version of the app here http://www.minecraft.net/download.jsp then y right click and "show package content", then find the resource folder, there should be folder named "Java", go inside and double click the "MinecraftLauncher.jar", the new launcher should ask you to login, just login with empty username and password. It'll fail to login and show two option, select the "play offline". To simplify the whole process, make an alias of the jar and put it on your desktop or whereever
